title.narrative: 001 CHILD PROTECTION POLICIES AND SYSTEM

description.narrative: By 2015, enabling policy, legal and institutional environment for birth registration, child justice, child-friendly social welfare and violence prevention strengthened at national, regional and kebele level, which contributes to Data And Child Protection, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2015, increased number of children who are registered, live in child-protecting families and communities and vulnerable children, including those in emergencies, benefit from gender sensitive and child friendly comprehensive interventions and services

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015, enabling policy, legal and institutional environment for birth registration, child justice, child-friendly social welfareand violence prevention strengthened at national, regional and kebele level

description.narrative: Towards building a national child protection system, UNICEF supported the respective IPs and exhibited major results like the establishment of the vital events registration agency as well as the revitalization of the child wellbeing management information system. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2016

title.narrative: A National coordination body for registration of vital events established and functioning

actual.value: 2016:Met. National Coordination body for VERA is established and functioning

title.narrative: A central authority to govern inter country adoption practices and procedures is established

actual.value: 2016:Not met. The activity is constrained. The comprehensive National assessment on ICA system is still pending. There is a move at the Government level especially in the Regions towards encouraging more domestic adoption as against inter- country ones. An assessment was conducted by one of the adopting

title.narrative: A National child well being management information system in place

actual.value: 2016:Ongoing. Child Wellbeing MIS Database Development –The project is now led by the Ministry with a steering committee and an alternate donor in place. UNICEF continues to provide technical support to the committee.
